name: Sheraton Panama City

reviews.text: There were many positive aspects to my stay at the Sheraton in Panama City, including the service and the updated room decor. Room service was always prompt and the staff were helpful and friendly. During a city-wide power outage, which prevented us from getting to our rooms, hotel staff came around the lobby area with cold drinks to ensure that everyone was as comfortable as possible. The room was spacious and always clean.
reviews.title: Overall Pretty Good

reviews.text: My only problem was with the air conditioning, which was always too cold. Although the thermostat was set at 78F, the temperature in the room was always around 68. Most nights, I had to turn off the air conditioner before going to bed, but usually had to turn it back on later when it the room got too warm. I reported the problem to the front desk, but it was never resolved during my stay. Overall, my stay was quite good, but I wish the ventilation problem could have been fixed.
reviews.title: Excelent location and service

reviews.text: O had a wonderfull experience at the Sheraton Panama Hotel and Convention Center, I have to congratulate, Felix at the front desk, Massiel Sales Manager, the BEST concierge helpfull , nice, always smiling dear TOMAS YOU ARE THE BEST!!, also I have to CONGRATULATE the staff at the Lounge 15th floor, the 2 fantastic ladys who welcome us for 7 days, I have to thank them how nice and professional they are, congratulations !! The food was ok, breakfast so so, swimming pool bad service, not good at all, the life gurd the best , ..the hotel has a fantastic location, Very good job Sheraton Staff!!
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: I can say I spent 7 days at home...thank you all!!
reviews.title: Just remodeled

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel with family (4 rooms) for 4 nights and were very pleased. We had an executive suite which we found to be well worth the extra money. We had 2 separate full bathrooms and closet areas along with a nice living room. We were also given access to the executive lounge which was amazing. Terrific full breakfast (with omelet and waffle station) in the morning and a very nice wine and appetizers in the early evening. The exercise room was fantastic and the pastry shop was so delicious and convenient. The location although not great for walking anywhere was very convenient to the airport. We will definitely plan to stay at the Sheraton on our return trips to Panama.
reviews.title: Very well kept, great location. excellent service

reviews.text: Wouldn't stay here if the company wasn't paying the bill.
reviews.title: Good & Terrible at the same time....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is not good for a tourist. as mentioned by others, there's nothing within walking distance.
reviews.title: First and Last Time

reviews.text: But the rooms are decent, the room service is very fast, staff is quite friendly.
reviews.title: A HELPFUL HINT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And then:
reviews.title: Large nice hotel, area is soso

reviews.text: The maids turn off the AC so the room is stifling upon your return.
reviews.title: No good, no bad, but requires renewal and better training to personnel on customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel: We found all the staff to be exceptional and helpful. We always made sure to have smaller bills for tips which is greatly appreciated. The pool is large and has lots of lounging chairs. The rooms are a bit more dated compared to other Sheratons but we were very happy with them and weren't spending too much time in the rooms anyways. We didn't hear any noises at night and we knew that there were people staying on both sides of us.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Sheraton

reviews.text: Location: Central location which is good to see the major sites, but in terms of walking distance, the hotel does not have too much around it.
reviews.title: Lacking in Customer Service/Execution Terrible Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: We were happy with the food at the restaurant. There is a good spot in the hotel for coffee and a quick breakfast of pastries/ muffins, etc. Otherwise, there is not much within walking distance around the hotel which is disappointing.
reviews.title: Above & Beyond

reviews.text: Taxis around Panama from the Hotel: I recommend not arranging a taxi through the hotel as the quoted prices are 2x or 3x the price that I ultimately ended up finding on the street. Instead, walk a block or two from the hotel and flagging down a taxi. When we were in Panama (and I think for the next two years) as the Metro is being built many taxis are unwilling to do the drive and will charge much higher prices. For example, from Casco Viejo to the hotel is approx. 10 minutes with minimal traffic, but one day it took over an hour during rush hour. Just a few quick notes on the prices we paid when flagging down a taxi as a reference point from the hotel:
reviews.title: freezing penguins!! and it lacks the extra step

reviews.text: - Hotel to Casco Viejo/ Mercado de Mariscos $4 (lowest paid) - $10. We couldn't find anything less than $30 to come back during "rush hour" from Casco (around 5.00pm). We just hung out until traffic died down.
reviews.title: PANAMA GPS Helped us find this hotel is was great!!
Well Run Hotel
reviews.text: Situated in the San Francisco district so a bit quieter than the city centre, it's only 15 minutes to the main airport. The bedrooms are a little tired but beds and bedding are good. Very friendly and helpful staff in all areas, good to see some of the managers around and about checking on service levels. The main buffet restaurant offers good quality breakfast and lunch, lots of choice. There is a 24 hour coffee shop, where you can get a hamburger, club sandwich etc, the cakes are popular. Good WiFi all around the hotel including pool area. Room Service was excellent, they guarantee to have your order delivered within 30 minutes or it's free, so they are confident with their service standards. I found from the lady taking your order to the chap delivering the food to be very professional. Enjoyed my stay.

I travel allot as part of my work. Its been a long time since I stayed in a hotel under 200$ that felt like a 400$ per night. A fine hotel allover, the lobby, the rooms, the service. The place to stay in Panama city!
reviews.title: This is a really 5 stars hotel +the price is very attractive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Sheraton Atlapa since it was the Caesar Park and, if anything, the quality has improved over the past several years. Since local owners purchased it over four years ago, the hotel has undergone remarkable renovations that are still to be completed. The rooms have been fully renovated and they are clean and comfortable. To the new owners' credit, many of the hard working and friendly staff that made staying there always a pleasure remain at the hotel. The restaurants remain some of the best in the area, with Las Hadas bakery a high point of any stay. The breakfast, lunch, & dinner buffets at the Bahia restaurant are very popular with locals for their high quality of food at exceptional value. The fitness center has been converted into a first class gym popular with many locals and American expats. The pool area is an oasis, even during the summer (December to April) when local families send their children for day camp so relaxing by the pool in the mornings can be a challenge because of the noisy children. The hotel is located in a mostly residential area rather than the financial or central parts of the city. This gives the hotel great views, particularly from rooms facing the ocean. We prefer pool and city views because they are more interesting but these rooms can be a bit noisy during weekends when locals come in droves for parties in the hotel. The only negative at this time is that the hotel's renovations make getting in and out of the hotel a challenge and there is only valet parking at this time. However, since traffic in Panama make driving a nightmare, we rent a car only to drive to the beach or the country and rely on plentiful, very cheap, safe, and mostly reliable taxi cabs while in the city. For a few dollars more, the hotel offers its own fleet of cars to drive guests around the city.
reviews.title: Excellent value Hotel popular with locals

reviews.text: The rooms are very nice, however there is a weird slope to into the room (over the threshold) and once you are on the marble slab by the closet there is a downward slope where the carpet meets the marble. This was very awkward and potentially dangerous in the middle of the night. All of us (husband & two children) tripped more than once. Also we were traveling with my Grandmother in the adjecent room and so worried she was going to trip and fall onto the marble and break something.
reviews.title: Rooms are nice but

reviews.text: The bathrooms are very, very tiny and the shower is poorly designed. Although it looks nice, water leaks everywhere, making the marble floor slippery ad again creating a potentially hazardous situation.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: The room was typical for a Sheraton and was adequate for a few days' stay. The bed, however, was not very comfortable and it frequently caused me to awaken in the middle of the night with soreness in limbs and shoulders. I didn't see anything special about the location, although the hotel is part of the convention center complex.
reviews.title: The Sheraton Panama City left me cold...

reviews.text: My biggest complaint was that for three days it was impossible to get hot water in the shower. On the first morning there, I notified the front desk of the problem, but it was never resolved. Every morning I had to will myself to get into a cold shower before heading off to conduct business. The strange thing was that warm (not hot) water was available from the faucet in the bathroom, but hot water never reached the shower. Anecdotal evidence from colleagues staying at the Sheraton was that hot water was once available at 5:00 in the morning and another time at 11:30 at night, but no one was able to get a hot shower at a reasonable time.
reviews.title: WOW! I love the room!

reviews.text: I will be traveling back to Panama City later this year and I may, for various work reasons, have to stay at the Sheraton again. If so, I can only hope that their hot water problems are fixed by then.
reviews.title: Great overall

reviews.text: This hotel is awesome! The room was huge, the prices were reasonable. They helped me with my WIFI and the staff was very nice (except for a lady that was rude at the pastry shop to the gringos and the man that rolled his eyes when I ordered a drink at the lobby bar. The breakfast was also a bit expensive. Despite that, I recommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: False charges.

reviews.text: Very nice rooms with comfortable beds. Fantastic gym with lots of workout equipment. Jimmy restaurant down the street good with reasonable prices
reviews.title: It was ok for one night...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at The Sheraton Panama one night on our arrival in Panama City, it is one of two Sheratons in the city, this being the lesser known,(the other one is The Four Points) our taxi drivers on two occasions almost took us to the other hotel, had I not specified "Not Four Points"
reviews.title: No Complaints, Good Stay.

reviews.text: The initial impression was a good one lobby is spacious and attractive, front desk staff are amazingly helpful and friendly, kudos to Horacio and to Denisse, who when we inquired about a restaurant we had been to before, which she did not know, she looked it up for us, made dinner reservations, and wrote instructions on a piece of paper for us to give the taxi driver. Juan from Bocas was also a super friendly porter who had lots of tips for us on the city. All spoke great English.
reviews.title: Good accommodations in a good location

reviews.text: We stayed in a standard room on an upper floor that had a partial view of the ocean. Maybe this room had already been renovated, because we saw no evidence of the wear mentioned by other reviewers, in fact we had just stayed in a Sheraton in Canada before our trip and the room was almost identical. Beds were comfortable, noise level was low, though we did not have an adjoining room door, cleanliness was good.
reviews.title: Very good but the place is showing its age

reviews.text: Only negative, we were charged for something that we did not have, on our quick check out invoice and when we questioned about this when leaving, it was quickly rectified, I honestly think it was a mistake, and not an intent to rip us off. Still it's always good to carefully check those sheets of paper that come under your door in the middle of the night.
reviews.title: Safe bet for a short stay in Panama City

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel 3 times during our recent move to Panama. The rooms are a little above average, although not as clean as in the U.S. and the staff, for the most part, speaks a little English and most of the time will at least try to understand what you are saying. The bakery, Las Hadas, is supposed to be the ONLY place in Panama City to buy your sweets. We found it to be very disappointing during our stays-frankly don't understand what all the rage is about. The breakfast buffet is excellent. The hotel has a nice pool area and a decent gym. They're undergoing some remodeling, which they needed because the property is showing its age. All in all, comfortable accommodations.
reviews.title: Nice dependable hotel
Good Sheraton standard and avccurate service
reviews.text: You may find here the tipical Sheraton's standards: good location, large rooms and accurate service: not luxury but a 4 starts-superior kind of place. Location is convenient to move around the cuty and to head to airport (regardless the heavy traffic during most of the day). Been upgraded to a suite with great harbour view. For the gamblers there is a Casino attached to the hotel.
This is a very nice hotel with excellent service. Food is good too at the Crostini. The location is not bad unless you want to find activity nearb. Will definitely return when I am back in Panama!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, good service

reviews.text: I will try to write a positive review about a really, really bad experience. I am a frequent business traveler with a lot of mileage in Panama and Latin America.
reviews.title: Poor service really messed the whole experience

reviews.text: The hotel is very well kept, rooms are comfortable, internet is just average, restaurants are good, lobby is beautiful and charming, gym is outstanding. Location is not the best, especially if you are going to work in the banking district.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, not great location

reviews.text: What really annoyed me was an attitude of trying to milk every penny out of you, without giving corresponding service. As soon as I checked in I was tricked into accepting an "upsale" which would give me included internet and free breakfast for an additional 30% of my original rate. It turned out that breakfast was just supposed to give me access to the executive lounge, which was denied when I tried to enter. As I insisted that I had paid for that very unfriendly staff member told me that I did not have the right to be there since I was not in an executive floor. Only after complaining rather strongly was I able to enter the lounge. All in all I felt cheated and humiliated.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, weird location....

reviews.text: Stayed a few days for a trade expo at the other side of the street, location very convenient.
reviews.title: Good hotel, kind staff

reviews.text: Has everything you should expect from a Sheraton hotel. Staff is really kind, helped me immediately with wifi-connection, adapter and some other questions I had.
reviews.title: Great Property, Great Experience

reviews.text: Decent (though not great) breakfast buffet and bar and restaurant pretty good as well.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location

reviews.text: Gym looked great but could not use it (too busy and lazy).
reviews.title: Good hotel, good service!!!

reviews.text: Bit pricey (probably because of the expo) and charging extra for wifi is not of this era anymore. Any (business) hotel should include this is room rate these days.
reviews.title: Good & quiet hotel

aka: Sheraton Panama City Hotel Panama City
